Package commands

Class Imm

java.lang.Object
commands.Imm
public class Imm extends Object
Manages an immediate (.imm) directive-type instruction.

The immediate directive is used to set the numeral base of immediate data types for the disassembler. It has no impact on the function of the assembler.

Three values exist for the immediate directive, which takes a single argument: dec for decimal (base 10), hex for hexademical (base 16), and default to automatically choose between hex/dec based on the instruction type.

The complete syntax for an immediate directive is: .pragma imm <hex|dec|default>

Once set, the immedate type is persisted for all instructions until the next immediate directive. The default (if no immediate directive exists) is equivalent to .imm default being placed at the top of the machine code file.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Imm getInstance(String type)
      Constructs a new instance of an Imm object with a given type.
      Parameters:
      type - a string representing the immediate directive type. This string must be "hex", "dec", or "default".
      Returns:
      a new Imm object with the specified type. If the type is not recognized, then null is returned.

    • getType

      public Imm.Type getType()
      Returns the immediate value type specified by this immediate directive.
      Returns:
      the immediate value type specified by this immediate directive.

    • toAssembledString

      public String toAssembledString()
      Returns this immediate directive as an assembled string.

      The format of this string is: .pragma imm <hex|dec|default>

      Returns:
      this immediate directive as an assembled string.

    • toAssemblyString

      public String toAssemblyString()
      Returns this immediate directive as a line of assembly code.
      Returns:
      always null, because the immediate directive is only used in assembly code.
